title: Fact Check: Did Mark Zuckerberg Say 'Jai Shri Ram' Is Written On Facebook Over 200 Crore Times?
subtitle: The Logical Indian Fact check team investigates a claim that is viral on Facebook and Twitter which says that Mark Zuckerberg stated that 'Jai Shri Ram' is written more than 200 crore times on...
author: thelogicalindian.com
vclaim:
A graphic is doing the rounds on social media which says that Mark Zuckerberg has said that everyday over 200 crore times 'Jay Shri Ram' are written on Facebook.

Similar posts were found earlier this month around the time of the Bhoomi pujan of Ram temple in Ayodhya. On August 5, Prime Minister Narendra Modi participated in a "Bhoomi Pujan" or a groundbreaking ceremony to mark the building of a grand Ram temple in Ayodhya.



The viral graphic uses pictures of the Facebook founder, Mark Zuckerberg and Hindu God Ram. The translated version of the text reads "Jai Shri Ram is written more than 200 crore times on Facebook every day, says Facebook inventor Zuckerberg."

Mark Zuckerberg stated that 'Jai Shri Ram' is written more than 200 crore times on Facebook every day. No such official statement was found on Facebook founder's social media accounts. Further, news reports mentioning such statistics were also not found. Facebook's Blog newsroom which updates on the latest news, announcements and media resources from the Facebook company, too did not show up any such result for 'Jai Shri Ram'.
